WGMap Documentation

v0.1.0

Requirement

  • wednus.js
  • wps.js
  • wom.js
  • GMap API key

Introduction

This control is a simple wednusified version of GMap API. To use this control on your domain, you need to get a GMap API key and set the value of the variable 'W.c.WGMap.key' in WGMap.js as: 
 W.c.WGMap.key = 'ABQIAAAA03ZOZ6fLoh0uVJ65IOW3xRT2yXp_ZAY8_ufC3CFXhHIE1NvwkxRTZd5iunEbnfpa6qZ4XBVkQbg72Q';
Note:
For testing using a local webserver, you may use the following key for 'http://localhost': ABQIAAAA03ZOZ6fLoh0uVJ65IOW3xRT2yXp_ZAY8_ufC3CFXhHIE1NvwkxRTZd5iunEbnfpa6qZ4XBVkQbg72Q
See also:
To claim a GMap API key, you need to go http://www.google.com/apis/maps/signup.html
Test:
testing constructor & member methods

Diagram

Usage

1. Including

Add following line of code in script block. 
 W.control('WGMap');

2. Instantiate a control object

In either case, Wednus Platform will loadup the control, and now we can use the control like this: 
 var myTemp = new W.WGMap();

3. Using object

After the object creation, you can access public member properties and methods as below. 
 alert(myTemp.name);

Code Example

This example will add a fullsized('100%,100') map. 
 <script type='text/javascript'>
 W.control('WGMap');
 </script>

 <script type='text/javascript'>
 var map = new W.WGMap();
 map.wps = '100%,100%,left:0,top:0';
 </script>

Test:
CodeExample.html
Warning:
Do not merge the two script blocks into one because the control should need to be fully loaded before any use.
